title: Jinbe Will Join the Straw Hat Crew
theoryText: After seeing Jinbe's honorable character and his willingness to sacrifice his Warlord position for his principles, fans theorized that Jinbe would eventually join Luffy's crew. His introduction as a principled warrior who values loyalty and his clear opposition to the World Government's methods made him seem like a natural fit for the Straw Hats. The theory suggested that after the war, Jinbe would need a new purpose and would align with Luffy's goals.
author: One Piece Community (Multiple Sources)
evidence: Jinbe's principled nature aligns with Luffy's values
His debt to Whitebeard mirrors the loyalty Luffy inspires
He is a former Warlord, making him powerful enough for the crew
Fish-Man representation would diversify the crew

title: Level 6 Prisoners Will Escape During the War
theoryText: With the reveal of powerful Level 6 prisoners expressing their desire to kill Whitebeard, fans theorized that the chaos of Luffy's infiltration and the upcoming war would create an opportunity for a mass breakout from Eternal Hell. The theory suggested that these legendary criminals could become major threats in the future or could be recruited by other powerful figures like Blackbeard.
author: One Piece Community
evidence: Luffy's infiltration has already caused chaos in multiple levels
The prisoners are openly discussing their ambitions
Blackbeard's mysterious plans were still unknown
Impel Down had never been breached before, making it vulnerable

title: Whitebeard's Protection of Fish-Man Island Foreshadows Luffy Taking Over
theoryText: When Jinbe explained how Whitebeard protected Fish-Man Island by claiming it as his territory, fans theorized that after Whitebeard's death (which seemed likely given the war setup), Luffy would eventually take over the protection of Fish-Man Island. This would parallel Luffy's tendency to help those in need and would create a connection between Whitebeard's legacy and Luffy's growing influence as a pirate.
author: One Piece Community
evidence: Luffy has a pattern of helping oppressed people and locations
Jinbe's introduction to Luffy's story suggests a future connection
The parallel between Whitebeard and Luffy as protectors
Fish-Man Island would need a new protector if Whitebeard falls

title: Crocodile Will Reluctantly Help Luffy Escape
theoryText: Given Crocodile's presence in Level 6 and Luffy's mission to reach Ace, fans theorized that Crocodile might end up working with Luffy despite their past as enemies. The theory suggested that Crocodile's desire to kill Whitebeard and Luffy's need to save Ace could align their goals temporarily, leading to an unlikely alliance during the prison break.
author: One Piece Community
evidence: Crocodile's expressed desire to face Whitebeard in battle
The chaotic situation in Impel Down creating strange alliances
Luffy's pattern of working with former enemies when goals align
Both characters have reasons to leave Impel Down

title: The Sphinx's Noodle Speech Has Deeper Meaning
theoryText: Some fans theorized that the Sphinx's quirk of speaking only in noodle names might have a deeper connection to Japanese wordplay or could be foreshadowing something about Impel Down's history. The theory suggested that the creature might have been exposed to prisoners who discussed food constantly due to the starvation conditions, or that 'go-men' (sorry/noodles) was intentionally symbolic of the regret felt by those imprisoned.
author: One Piece Community
source: Fan discussions about Impel Down creatures
evidence: Impel Down creatures mimic words without understanding
Oda's love of wordplay and puns in character design
